meanings.definition: To officially exclude someone from participation in the sacraments and services of the Christian Church.
meanings.sent1: The church had to excommunicate the person for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent2: The priest decided to excommunicate the member who had been causing trouble.
meanings.sent3: It was a serious matter when they had to excommunicate the troublemaker from the church.
meanings.sent4: The decision to excommunicate the individual was a last resort to maintain order.
meanings.sent5: The act of excommunicate was a solemn and weighty responsibility for the church leaders.

meanings.definition: To exclude someone from a group or community.
meanings.sent1: The club had to excommunicate the troublemaker to keep peace.
meanings.sent2: The community decided to excommunicate the person who was causing division.
meanings.sent3: It was necessary to excommunicate the disruptive member from the team.
meanings.sent4: The decision to excommunicate the troublemaker was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent5: The act of excommunicate was a tough but needed action to maintain harmony.
